text:
Utica is a city in Ness County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 158 people lived there.
History.
The first post office in Utica was created in 1879.
Utica was named by early pioneer C.W. Bell. He was from Utica, New York, so he named it after that city.
Geography.
Utica is at (38.642899, -100.169024). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 158 people, 78 households, and 42 families living in Utica.
